summary: This document is an email correspondence involving Jeffrey Epstein and Sultan Bin Sulayem discussing the refinancing of a loan for the Dukes Hotel in London. The email outlines the financial details of the hotel acquisition and the need for refinancing due to current financial conditions.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the sender of the email and is involved in discussions regarding the refinancing of a loan for the Dukes Hotel.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Jes Staley is the recipient of the forwarded email and is involved in the refinancing discussions.

persons.name: Sultan Bin Sulayem
persons.context: Sultan Bin Sulayem is involved in the refinancing discussions and provides details about the Dukes Hotel and the financial situation.

connections.description: Jeffrey Epstein and Sultan Bin Sulayem are discussing the refinancing of a loan for the Dukes Hotel, indicating a business relationship.
Jeffrey Epstein is forwarding information to Jes Staley regarding the refinancing of the Dukes Hotel, indicating a business relationship.
Sultan Bin Sulayem is communicating with Jes Staley about the refinancing requirements for the Dukes Hotel, indicating a business relationship.

locations: Dukes Hotel, 35-37 St James Place, London
keyFacts: The Dukes Hotel was acquired in September 2006 for £40 million.
Moderate refurbishment of the hotel cost approximately £2 million.
The total cost incurred for the hotel, including acquisition and refurbishment, is £43 million.
The hotel is financed through Emirates NBD London branch with a total finance of £36 million.
The refinancing is sought to delay repayment and reduce interest burden due to current financial conditions.
